text: This place is amazing. I could eat here everyday. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming and the food is awe inspiring. I've developed a taste for spicy food because of this place and now I can't get enough. Any meat dish is cooked to perfection always tender and perfectly flavored. The prices are decent and the atmosphere is peaceful although I'd love to see them expand. I cannot stress enough how good the food is!

Oh my this is delicious!! My husband and I are always looking to try different types of food and Indian food was a bit new for us. I'm so glad we found this restaurant because it definitely made Indian food fans out of us! I had a cauliflower-potato dish that was so flavorful (and made great leftovers too!)

Decided to visit this place during a weekend getaway to Vegas after seeing reviews on yelp and trip advisor. 

Food: Tastes great (we had Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken, Chili Shrimp), Spiced to taste, smaller portions (one entry feeds 1 adult), garlic naan was excellent (kids swore it was the best they've ever had), the fact that they had Indo Chinese choices was a huge plus as well. Only con was the dessert (they lost a star for this)- Gulab Jamun was not good at all, and they still charged us for it even though I said it wasn't edible. They serve it cold, and the insides were rock hard. Overall, this was the best Indian food I've had in a very long time.

Decor: Elegant, nothing too fancy, but tasteful. In a quiet, residential area.

Service: Very friendly, at times a tad slow, not too sure who our server was, at times it was a guy, at times it was the hostess who was quite nice.

Cost: A little pricey (~ $15/entree). Bill for 2 adults and 2 kids was ~ $100 without drinks.
Raj and Ritesh, thank you for a great Indian restaurant in the Northwest. If you love real authentic Indian food you have to give Saffron a try. My wife and I love it!
Best Indian food in Las Vegas!  Staff is friendly and very attentive.  Always a great experience!

I've probably tasted half of what is on their menu. Everything is wonderful. The tiki masala is great....even with the heat at 10. Atmosphere is really nice even though the restaurant is nestled in a somewhat mundane strip mall.

Tried Saffron Flavors of India for takeaway dinner on a whim and came away very impressed. The food was excellent. 

Small thing, for me, when I arrived on time for pickup the food wasn't ready. Another takeaway customer arrived and had the same problem. They've got some timing issues, but I was able to easily overlook that by the quality of the food, which is for sure the best available in Las Vegas (and I've tried just about all of them).

While I waited for my food I noticed the restaurant looked great. A large, fully-stocked bar and a comfortable, modern dining room. For me, Saffron is a little out of the way, but I'm happy to overlook that too for their excellent food. Glad to have found it.
Absolute Yum! Everything we ordered was great -  Bhindi Masala, Chicken Biryani, Dal Makhani

Went for the lunch buffet and LOVED it. I wanted sushi, but my husband argued for Indian, and I'm so glad we came here! (It was like half the price of sushi, too, so there's that...) The place had a great atmosphere, they were very generous with the naan, and service was great. There were some dishes I wasn't crazy about, but I think that's more of a personal preference, and that's the great thing about a buffet- you can just try something else. I loved the chicken tikka masala and there was a paneer veggie dish that was incredible. The only reason this review isn't a 5, was we like it spicy. Like, INDIAN spicy. I know that's the trouble with a buffet, you have to appeal to a lot of customers, but nothing I tried had much heat. BUT the flavors were still incredible. Can't wait to come back for dinner so I can order it INDIAN SPICY!

We tried this place a few days ago. We should have known these reviews were too good to be true. We were the only people in the place for an early dinner, not a great sign but we sat down any way. I did notice a good about is business was coming in and out for carry out, not that it mattered to me. The decor was nice I guess for a restaurant in a strip mall, they could not have done much else to spruce up the place.

Our food came out pretty quick and was served in nice dish ware. The rice that came out for us to share was cold. But my dish was just flavorless. It was a pea, cauliflower curry dish and it tasted like nothing. My fianc√© ordered chicken tikka masala and had a similar complaint, way too bland. Our meal was over $35, no way we would come back.
Wonderfully flavored dishes. Prompt, friendly service. You'll want to order plenty so that you'll have enough to take home for leftovers the next day.  :)

This has to be the best Indian restaurant in Vegas and there are probably a dozen of Indian restaurants. I hope this restaurant gets the recognition it serves. The food is fresh and the restraint is clean. They have a garlic cheese naan to die for and their chili paneer is amazing.

I've visited this establishment twice, once for dinner and more recently for their reopened lunch buffet. For dinner, the food was okay, but the service was severely lacking. It took forever (about 2 hours total) to order our food, get water and refills, get our food and finally pay our check. The butter chicken was so-so. The aloo gobi even less remarkable. The 2 kinds of naan were too doughy. Despite this mediocre experience, I was willing to give their lunch buffet a try, especially since the wifey was curious to experience their cuisine. What a mistake that was... First of all, the price of $11.99 is at the high end for Indian lunch buffets, and this place is the exception to the rule that you get what you pay for. The selection and quality was downright pathetic and frankly embarassing. Ok, to be fair, it was still better than our abysmal experience at Sherpa House (in Golden, CO) but that is setting the bar extremely low. There were a whopping total of 8 hot trays consisting of items such as onion "pakora" (basically onion ring fragments), orange chicken, daal, chana masala, goan fish curry, lamb curry, paneer masala, and (non-Basmati) rice. There was also a small salad bar section and kheer. There was a surprising lack of classic staples such as mango chutney, samosas, Tandoori chicken, any kind of chicken curry, or saag. Although we enjoyed the fish curry, it could not make up for the lack of selection and quality of the rest of items. The garlic naan was so-so. It was simultaneously too doughy yet too hard and dry on the bottom. The kheer was the worst we've ever had. It lacked cardamom flavor and contained numerous clumps of rice. At least this time around, the service was half decent. The only other mitigating factor was they were running a $2 off promotion, although we had to specifically ask for the discount to be applied. That being said, the fact that this place garners stellar reviews is a real head scratcher. Perhaps, restaurants located in the (relative) boonies are held to a lower standard. Who knows? As for me, when I rate a restaurant, I don't care where a restaurant is located. The food is either good or it isn't. It's either a good value or it isn't. Unfortunately, this place is neither.
Love this place!!! Delicious cheese naan and chicken tandoori. If you want a drink, try an Indian Summer. It's a sneaky drink, more alcohol than you think.

Last night I had dinner at Saffron with three other members of my family.  We had lentil soup and vegetarian samosas as appetizers.  As main courses we had the bhindi masala (okra), lamb vindaloo, chicken curry and aloo ghobi (potatos and mixed vegetables).   Everything was delicious and we were pleased with the service as well.

Portions were big enough for all of us to share some of each other's food and the price was not unreasonable.  Overall it was a very satisfactory experience and I'll be glad to return to the restaurant on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Great little place!! Husband and I stopped here for the lunch buffet on our way out of Las Vegas and I'm so glad we did. I'm Indian and thought the food was very good. Flavors were delicate and not overdone. They had interesting dishes on the buffet menu (corn+spinach curry, anyone?) and it was not super-heavy like Indian lunch buffets usually are. They bring hot, fresh, naan out to your table. Service was attentive and just right. Ambiance is a nice blend of Indian and Southwestern without overdoing either. 
We loved it so much that we stopped by again to pick up chicken biryani a few days later. It tasted more like chicken pulav, but was still very  good. 

Go find this place, you won't be disappointed!

Really great place. We had dinner there tonight and sadly had the place to ourselves. However, unlike a lot of places that just seem to "give up" when they don't have a lot of business on a particular night, the staff at Saffron seemed to be working extra hard for our approval! Our hostess/waitress was very friendly and accommodating, ensuring that we had everything we needed without hovering.
 The food was absolutely excellent as well. My husband had a lamb dish, which he ordered medium spicy, while I had the mattar paneer at no spice. Both of ours was delicious and seasoned perfectly. They don't seem to fall into the trap that "more spice = more flavor" that I have encountered at some places where a "5" actually equals "nuclear reactor in your mouth hot."  Now that I know they have a fine hand at spices, I may actually order a little heat next time!
 We also got the cheese naan, which I HIGHLY recommend! Tender, filled with just enough cheese to add flavor and texture without making it greasy. 
Their menu is just long enough to give you lots of options but not so long that it's overwhelming. It has a huge vegetarian section, with lots of choices for even the pickiest eater. 
 Long story short, we will be back! Hopefully next time it will be full to the rafters busy!
I love this place! The food is amazing. Great service. I definitely recommend this place to Indian food lovers.
Very less options ..!!! And tasted bad..!!! Chana masala tasted like the frozen version bought from an indian grocery store.

Super kid friendly! Staff goes above and beyond to make your little ones feel welcome.

Excellent food. Loved the Peshawari Nan and Chicken Korma. Kids loved the plain nan. 

Don't wait to give it a try and bring the whole family!

It's about time I write a review for Saffron.  My husband and I eat here so much that the waiter knows our drink orders and what we want to eat.  The place is really good, really! I used to frequent other Indian restaurants down by the strip until Saffron came along.  Not only does Saffron taste better than the other places in town, their prices are much more reasonable.  Best garlic naan ever!

what a great find!!!  thank you Yelpers!!

i had a certificate for restaurant.com that was expiring and we wanted to try something different.  after bouncing between their site and here, we decided to give Saffron a try.  thank you to Whitney for posting the location behind the McDonalds; otherwise we might have missed it!

we walk up toward their OPEN sign and get pointed to the door down tot he right.  why in the world would you put that sign next to doors you do not use?!?!?  anyway, we were told we could sit anywhere we wanted as we were the only ones there.  the young man was probalbly new because he could not answer a question about one of the naans.  no big deal.

we started with the garlic naan, bullet naan, tandoori chicken wings, and the sampler.  both naans were very tasty and the wings were also very good. the sampler was also eaten pretty fast, even though it was a bit spicy; probably a 7 on a 1-10 scale.  we were not asked how spicey we wanted the sampler, but were asked for our entrees. everything was nice and tender.  everyone also loved the mango lassi; not too sweet but yummy.

3 of us ordered the tikka mix (lamb, chicken, shrimp, but no fish as mentioned on the menu) and our 4th ordered the shrimp saag.  the tikka was very good (silly of us to get the sampler as an appetizer and the mix for the entree, but it was good stuff!).  very flavorful and nicely spiced.  the girls raved about the saag.

prices were reasonable, portions were good, but service was a bit slow.  we'll have to go back and try more of the many items on the menu!

Meh. The cheese Nan bread was just cheddar cheese grilled inside the bread, totally indistinguishable from a quesadilla at a Mexican restaurant. We had the Butter Makkni chicken...they use tandoori chicken, which is grilled so it's not particularly soft. Overall, pretty average...my wife and I eat at a lot of Indian restaurants and probably won't be back to this one.

I don't get over to the w side too often, but decided to go out of my way to try this place after spending a morning working @ Red Rock casino recently. 
No complaints about value- $12 lunch buffet in this town's pretty much the standard.
Pretty decent # of items offered too. Specifically, chicken tikka & korma, saag paneer, aloo ghobi, garlic naan were all good. I'll be back...

Yay! I'm a fan.

So I was going home from this side of town, and I desired a bit of good eats to arrive home with.  Here's a shout-out to Yelp for leading me to this place.  I never would have stumbled across this tucked away place otherwise.

Even if I happened upon this establishment, I'm not even sure I would have guessed it to offer take-out.  There's enough class inside that I actually asked if they even did, and soon found out I would be one of three doing the same.  There is a separate dining area from the bar, but from the passersby, I guess it to have accommodated them nicely.  The bar area seems to have a full compliment, and the tender definitely seemed to know his way around it (not that I sampled).  I sat at one of the few bar tables and watched the television they had up.  I was very kindly offered water or soda while I waited for my order; a first for me when getting take-out.

After perusing the entire dinner menu, I settled on the Chicken Tikka Masala -- caught my eye as it brings together the joys of the tandoor (grill/oven) with curry.  Luckily the dish comes with rice, as you really don't get a lot for the money here.  What you do get is quality over quantity, but I'm a fan of both.  I was asked on a scale of 1 to 10 how spicy I wanted it.  After discussion that I'm a fan of a little heat, we concluded that I should try an 8.  Well, the 8 tickled some, and it was flavorful -- not just spicy for its own sake.  It certainly carried the graceful interplay of spices and textures of good Indian food.  It had an acceptable amount of chicken that was cooked to perfection.  Delish it was most definitely.

So i have eaten at over 100 Indian food restaurants around the world and this is in my top 3.  Food is always consistently good.  Service is exceptional.  The owner and wait staff knew my preferences and what I wanted by my third visit.  I have tried over ten items on the menu and every one of the dishes sampled was great.  While I don't usually eat the garlic naan with my meals theirs is the best I've tasted.  I highly recommend you try this place.

Wow, what a great restaurant!  Let's start with the tandoori chicken.  Often a dry, if tartly tasty, disappointment, an afterthought in the vegetarian marvelousness that is Indian food in general.  Here, though, it was richly flavorful, moist and yielding -- seriously, the best I have ever had.  The people raving about the garlic naan bread are absolutely right -- fresh-baked, with just the right level of browned bottom.

The service was very pleasant -- maybe a bit over-attentive, because we arrived at a slow time.  That's a shame, because quite honestly, this restaurant should never have any slow times.

The decor is lovely -- draped curtains, mellow, classy atmosphere.  It's not a hole-in-the-wall by any means.  Overall, an outstanding restaurant, and I hope it catches on soon.

The yummiest Indian Food i have ever tried in the Town .. Specially try their Indo Chinese dishes.. Great food, Nice restaurant and awesome hospitality.. Not like other typical Indian Restaurant in the town..
Nice, little bit spicy. so order mild.Quality is no 1. I have very good experience of service.

Every time we travel to Las Vegas we leave the strip area for this good Indian food. It is a small place but we like that -- especially after dealing with crowds and rude people on the strip. Nice to be with the locals. Good food and prices.

I just love this place. The food, the drinks, the staff...this makes me happy. Even when dining with friends, everybody walks away in a delicious food coma with leftovers. I suggest anything in their red curry paired with a Kingfisher beer.

Saffron is my son's new favorite restaurant so he wanted them to cater his wedding rehearsal dinner. Every staff member I encountered while scheduling, planning the menu, and delivery and set-up was absolutely amazing! We had a salad, 5 different main dishes, 2 appetizers, 3 kinds of naan, and rice pudding. They not only delivered the food, but helped us transfer it into our serving dishes, etc and went well above and beyond expectations. Our guests raved about every dish- the samosas were a particular favorite. I'm thrilled with every aspect of the experience and had to create my first Yelp review to let the world know. Thank you, Saffron for a wonderful and memorable meal! 5 stars!!!!!

My husband and I go to Saffron for the buffet, because the food taste great and the staff are very friendly!  The items on the buffet are not super spicy, but everything has wonderful flavor.  Anyone reading this review should definitely check this place out!
Nice place, quickly seated. Food came fast! All staff are very polite! Clean restrooms.

Delicious food, refreshing cocktails and super friendly service are just a few of the reasons I feel Saffron Flavors of India deserves 4 stars. The friendly service was the first thing that impressed me when we arrived before they were actually open and they opened the doors and seated us immediately. We ordered their fantastic Saffron Martini and their delicious Samosas which I recommend to everyone.  The experience continued down that delicious path of dinner with Aloo Gobi, Vegetable Korma and Garlic Naan. We will come back soon.

This restaurant is beyond compare! My husband and I have traveled extensively through the world including India many times- and are admitted food snobs! We also lived in Surrey, British Columbia (little India) for several years. We struggled to find an amazing Indian restaurant, then my husband found this place and we have never looked back! All my friends who visit from around the world insist we go there again and again because they all love it so much! Their signature cocktails are also insanely good!!!

Waiter is very friendly and answered our questions since we have never been here or eaten Indian food before. Ordered the mixed grill and it's very tasty. Nice looking on the inside and friendly staff. So far so good.

Saffron Flavors of India is AMAZING!  This is the best Indian food!  Also this restaurant  is so clean and very special care is taken with the food.  The staff is so wonderful as well.  Simply put Saffron Flavors of India is simply the best!  I can't wait for the Curry Leaf to open up in downtown Las Vegas across from the container park.
These people know how to make great Indian food and are incredible restaurateurs
Racheal Martindale..
This place is nasty it should go out of business the people that work their a very rude the owner of this place is very rude and he try to hit on of my friends because he was so mad

Neighborhood restaurant that is amazeballs. Love this place. Usually do takeout (which is always fast and hot), but also enjoy eating in. Never had a bad meal here and they have a great bar too.
Nice job!!
The food is very tasty. The portions are small and the prices are high. 2 chicken dishes ala carte, rice, naan, and gulab (only 2 pieces = $5) cost more than $40

Went to Saffron Friday night at 8. We ordered Fish Tikka, vegetable korma, an okra dish and garlic Naan. The food was absolutely perfect. Spiced at 8, it was spicy yet not too hot. Kudos to Saffron. Great service once we got a seat.

I've eaten here at least 15x and everything is delicious! My absolute favorite is the Paneer Tikka Masala. The staff is very knowledgable and helpful for people new to Indian food. They have a full bar and a nice selection of wine. 

This is my favorite Indian restaurant in all of Las Vegas, and I recommend it to all! Enjoy!

Today (6/14/16) was my first time trying this place. They were super polite and obviously had a love for what they do.  We ordered the butter chicken, tikka masala, and a few types of naan. Everything was fantastic! Definitely coming back again.
Location was convenient, price was not bad, food was adequate, service was absolutely horrendous and completely unapologetic.

Went to Saffron a while ago.  I don't eat Indian food very often.  This pace was very good.  I enjoyed the food and the service.  The food was spicy and you can get it as hot as you like.  I'm not a big fan of spicy so I get mine as mild as I can.  They are happy to oblige.  The decorations and atmosphere is nice and peaceful.  I recommend Saffron when you are in the mood for Indian.  The food is very authentic.

Based on the reviews, we were really excited to taste food from this place. When we actually got the stuff, it wasn't good at all. It wasn't fresh and also was not properly cooked. We also complained about the food and nobody cared!! Horrible!!

Amazing food, great customer service! Originally went for the buffet. Had no idea the buffet had been discontinued. Decided to stay and my husband made such awesome menu choices. Still very impressed with the food. How ever i really wish they would bring the buffet back!!!

5 stars! I had never had Indian cuisine until tonight. The waiter was amazing and explained everything on the menu and what kind of meat was good with it. Very clean, inviting, and polite staff. Our drinks were NEVER empty. The food was high quality and super good. My Tika Masala was spicy, so without hesitation, my waiter brought out a cucumber yogurt sauce and said it was like a fire extinguisher. He was right! Go eat here. You won't regret it!!!:)

I love this place , 
I'm from England and could not find a good Indian until I came here .
The food is so good I would give it a 10
The happy hour is from 4-6 
2 for 1 on  well drinks and and domestic beers 
Free onion pakora  when u buy a drink 
Tastes so good

Usually when I look for food around my house, I try to find the best version of "the real thing" I can. Lo and behold my surprise when the BEST Indian restaurant is just down the street.

I would even say that Saffron is the best restaurant in North Las Vegas, period.

I've introduced several people to Indian food here and recently have found myself frequenting it almost weekly so I felt it was time to leave a review. Seriously, try this place. Next time I go I'll try to remember to update this review with menu items I recommend.

10/10 service, decor, and food. Amazing.

Pro tip: the guy behind the bar is the owner. Ask him what he recommends. He'll order something if the menu to suit your preferences.

PS: I hope he doesn't mind me mentioning that. =P

I ordered the chicken balti. The chicken tasted like it was just microwaved and the gravy didn't have any soul. It was overwhelmed with the taste of turmeric and cumin. The cocktail that I had was too watered down. Altogether, a bad experience.

Great Food, Great Service.  No Las Vegas Indian resturant  food comes close to the quality and the quantity as this place.  

Tried a bunch of items on the menu and enjoyed everything - Gobi Manchurian, chilly fish,lamb dum biryani, tandoori chicken, lamb curry, kabob platter.  

All items were flavorful and awesome.  Enjoyed dining at this place.  Will be back again!

Very solid food. The naan was delicious, and service was excellent. Good atmosphere for a weekend night. The main dishes were very good and they offer a "spiciness" level for almost every dish. I consider myself relatively good with spice (for a white girl raised on peanut butter sandwiches, I should add) but I overestimated myself here.

I went here hesitantly because everyone knows that Indian food can be rather odd considering most people are not of the culture. So I went there anyway for dinner and was rather surprised on the quality of the food and how classy and clean the place generally was. I was first greeted with complimentary appetizer and water from a young child. We ordered food that we couldn't quite pronounce the names of. Getting the food, OHHH MY GOD. Spicy, tasty, mysterious, interesting flavors with bestowed upon me. You cannot quite tell what exactly they put in their food but you just want more and more. I will certainly be back to experiment some more!

My husband and I first visited Saffron a few years ago just after it opened and had one of the most wonderful dining experiences ever! Tonight we decided to have a date night and without hesitation decided once again on Saffron. We were greeted immediately upon entering by the warmest of hosts. They weren't able to seat us right away and so invited us to have a seat in the bar while our table was being prepared. We are not all to familiar with Indian cuisine so when it came to ordering our waitress was extremely informative in guiding us though the selections. Our food came out piping hot and fresh. You could tell it was served immediately when finished cooking and had not sit in a window for at length of time. The favors and experience could not be topped in my opinion. I would recommend this exquisite place to everyone for any and all occasions. You will never be disappointed when you choose Saffron Flavors of India.

I have never had Indian food before and a family friend convinced us to try it because he loves it (especially their cashew curry sauce). I had no idea what to order, so stayed relatively safe with the Mutton Biryuni (sp?), which is pieces of seasoned mutton with seasoned rice. It was very good and, not knowing how spicy they do things, ordered a 1 out of 10 spiciness. It was very flavorful, but not what I would consider spicy much. I could probably handle a 3 next time. Anyway, the food comes family style, so ordering yourself a plate or two will get you a LOT of food. I had my rice dish for another 3 meals after taking it home. The wait staff was very attentive, but not overly so. Our friend asked for some cashew curry sauce to take home and they gave him a family size portion of it in one of those black hard plastic round containers. Very generous of them, I would say. I will definitely go back. It is worth driving from Green Valley to north of Summerlin for it.
I ordered some Naan and a mixed grill appetizer to go. The garlic naan is so tasty and the food was just amazing. Definitely going for a dinner sometime soon.

We wanted to get some Indian food but did not feel like trekking out to the center of town so we came here. This was not our first time here, but this trip was excellent. 

The service was on point! Very attentive without being overbearing. Well-timed refills on water glasses. Most of all, sincere friendly attitudes from everyone there.

The food was great. Perfect size on portions. Great flavor. We ordered butter chicken, chicken korma, and Chana masala. Also gotta have garlic naan. The sweet lassi was delicious, one of the best in town because it was thick and not watered down. Only negative was the pistachio kulfi for dessert was a little too icy, but still yummy.

We had a great experience here and definitely recommend this place.

Dont waste your time or money,i have had indian food 100 times,this time,i we decided to try a new place,and both dishes(chicken madras and chicken tikki massala,)both had no flavor,or spice,......the waitress comment...."everyone else likes it".......INDIAN PALACE IS STILL THE BEST IN VEGAS

I am from the U.K. Where there is an Indian restaurant on every corner. We found Saffron and it is right up there for taste and quality and service. I would rate Saffron 5 stars. I visit Saffron at least once a week.
Had a wonderful Indian dinner tonight.  The flavors of the dishes we had were spot on, good food and good service.  Will try the buffet at some point.

4.5 stars, rounding up to 5 because the food is just that good. Butter chicken and rice with paneer pakora are favorites. Especially the paneer and dipping sauces... top notch. Salivating just thinking about it. Service is always friendly and pretty fast. When I call in takeout it's always ready when I get there. For the portion size and venue, I think the prices are a bit steep (close to $30 for the chicken and paneer), so add bread and drinks, and you're looking at $40-50 a person. That's why I eat there once every 2 months instead of more often, even though it's the best Indian food on this side of town.

The people that run this place are really nice.  Given the hours of operation, I'm guessing this is a family owned and operated place, and it certainly has that feel.  They always seem happy to see someone come in, and are very accommodating.  Their lunch buffet is great, although I don't think the garlic naan is included anymore.  :/  Bummer on that one, because it's delicious, but the other food certainly makes up for it.  They have good seasoning with a mix of spices and flavors to work with anyone that enjoys Indian food.
Very good, got there at the end of lunch and the waiter had the chef prepare fresh main course rather than have us eat the buffet.  Suggestion for lunch arrive before 1300.   Great place for dinner

Save yourself a trip! Management was very rude to us after my 5 year old son got severly ill from their chicken dish, apparently the waitress could not tell us what was in the sauce and we had to run out of the restaurant and was severely ill all weekend from the food they served. I will not go back to this restaurant and do not recommend.

this place is FANTASTIC!!! the chili paneer, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, basmati rice, and chicken kurma were Amazing. The staff was incredibly friendly. I would recommend that anyone who is in the area eat here!!
Great food, friendly staff! Thought it was a little expensive at first but I got enough food for three meals. My new favorite place!

Went there tonight. Ordered my favorite dish Rogan Josh, the lamb was tough and stringy, taste ok. A hot curry shrimp dish which was not hot as all. An an assorted platter with chicken which was tough, shrimp which was over cooked and tasteless sausages. Ordered curry fish which was the best.
Excellent food. Polite staff. Always quick to respond. Good bar. Maybe add goat to the menu.
Food was amazing. Service was on point and very friendly. Lots of choices in Vegas to eat that you could possibles never have to come back...this place...I will frequently visit.

Disappointed in my family's meal last night. Decided to order to pick up and take home. This was a large order...2 orders of samosa, 2 garlic naan orders, 2 chicken makhani, 1 chicken korma, an order of the mixed grill, cauliflower, and 3 rice. Specified MILD and got home to food that I could barely eat, it was so hot. Didn't help that it was labeled "spy" which I am assuming is for "spicy". So frustrating since I live so far from the restaurant that I couldn't just hop back into the car to return it. When putting in the online order, is it so hard to read the instructions?  It clearly said "mild". Anyhow, other than that hiccup, the portion size looked okay and the flavor of the naan and the korma (the two things I could enjoy) were awesome. Will possibly go back but will need to dine in. I wouldn't trust the online order for pickup!

The food, drinks, service, decor, and speed make me come again and again. There's a cauliflower appetizer that was amazeballs. Their sign out front always has a witty quip on it. "Mother's Day specials--because you're the reason she drinks" sort of sassy stuff. The lunch buffet and dinner menu are both really good. The paneer tikka I got last time even wowed my carnivore boyfriend, who was already loving his chicken tandoori thing. The cocktails I've gotten so far are great.

My girlfriends and I go out once a week to different restaurants and we decided to give this place a shot. 
I must say I really enjoyed it. It wasn't too busy so we were seated immediately. The food was delicious and the portion sizes were sizable. I was able to take some home which was great! 
The dinners do not come with naan which was surprising so I ordered garlic and cheese naan for the table and I was MORE than happy to pay extra, it was wonderful!
Give this place a try, youll enjoy it.

Delicious food! Everything was wonderful. :) I recommend chicken tikka :)
The spice scale is a little tricky. If you just like a little to moderate spice I wouldn't order above a 4 on their scale. 
Gulab jamuns are best I've had at a restaurant and the naan bread is outstanding :) I would recommend

The best Indian food in Vegas, and it's not even close. The flavors are superior, the ingredients superior. I even like the interior. Try the Okra, and everything else!  Go! Eat! Enjoy! The rest is in the pictures, Cupcake.

This was the first time I have tried Indian food and it was seriously amazing! This restaurant had a fusion of Asian and Indian which I absolutely loved!

The cauliflower appetizer is an absolute must with a chili cilantro sauce that you should keep on the side for the delicious garlic na'an bread you receive with your entree. The chicken curry is brought out with white rice and was very flavorful and spicy. I tried the ginger snap house cocktail which had ginger, cilantro, and lime. A surprisingly refreshing and tasteful choice. The owner, Raj, was friendly, welcoming, and very helpful when recommending dishes for my boyfriend and I.

The restaurant itself is quite large with a full bar at the front and a second seating area reserved for larger parties. You have a choice to dine in or take out, I saw quite a few people coming in to pick up food to take home to their families. Pricing is fair, about $20-$25 per person for dinner. 

I highly recommend stopping in here for either lunch or dinner. It is delicious with the right amount of everything!

Very good Indian food... And I've definitely had better. But good and totally worth going to still. I've been numerous times because I live pretty close so it's convenient. And it's consistent.

Haven't had anything I didn't like here. Loved the fish tikka. Love the lamb dishes, chicken dishes, naan, etc. The chai tea is delicious too!

Finally got to give saffron a try. We were greeted and seated immediately at a table near the entrace to the dinning area, not our favorite but not bad overall. We ordered the vegetable samosas, chicken tandoori (heat lvl6), and chicken masala (heat lvl3). We were given crisp thin crackers that were very good, they had great flavor and came with two sauces. One was very savory with hints of citrus and herbs, the other a sweet jam like sauce that we preferred. Our vegetable samosas came and the shell had a great crunch, the filling of vegetables and curry was delicious and was complimented well with the two sauces. Then our main courses arrived, the chicken in both the dishes were cooked well, very tender, and the tikka masala had lots of flavor. The odd thing was that the folks masala (heat lvl3) was spicier than the tandoori (heat lvl6) although both was spicy it was very managable and was a welcomed level of heat. The servers were friendly, the restaurant was clean, and the food was good. So why the 3 star?? When we got there we were one of maybe six tables that had people and as time went on the dinner crowd came. Although not slammed we were then approached,by four different workers. One day us, one took our order, one brought our food, and another cleaned up. When our meal was coming to a close my water was not refilled nor even asked if I wanted any more water, to some it may not seem like much but for me having a beverage is a point I look at as it is much over looked. We were then asked if we would like any desserts and if we wanted a dessert menu and we said sure! So while the waiter took off we watched him, clean up tables, get water for other guests, and totally just forget about bringing us a dessert menu. Then our original waitress asked if we were done, at that point we were. So after getting our mean if payment ready we then watch all of the waitresses and waiter walk by us more then a handful of times and not once came to ask if the check was ready. My lady had to stop one of them so we could pay and continue our day. In my opinion the food was good but I overpriced and you dont get much for your dollar. So while the food is good, staff are friendly. There is still room for improvement, waitresses I believe should slow down and pay attention to their guest more and don't forget about others while more come in. We were not regulars but we could have been down the road. I'll be back to see if anything changes. Until then have a great night and treat all guest equally and don't forget about your first hues because two more walked through the door.

This was my 2nd trip. The first was uninspiring but I thought I would give it a 2nd chance. I specifically wanted a lunch buffet. This time, the buffet selection was paltry with barely a handful of main/side dishes. The food was fine my first trip but the price (increased from $11 to $13) was a deal breaker. Egg rolls? What part of India did egg rolls come from?

"Mount Everest" on Sahara has a phenomenal buffet! And it's $11.
Great place! We have eaten here several times and have enjoyed it every time!! I love the chicken jalfrezi and garlic naan!

The food was decent and the garlic naan was great.  

My main problem was with the service.  During the lunch hour, there were few people restaurant.  Despite the small crowd, the server was inattentive.  

The biggest problem came at the end of the meal.  Our party had a gift certificate from restaurant.com for 25 dollars.  Saffron refused to honor the gift certificate and claimed that the gift cards from restaurant.com could only be used at night.  I asked the server where on the website and on the gift card the restriction was located, and he could not point out the clause.  

To those in my party, it felt like the Saffron pulled a bait and switch.  It left all of us feeling disappointed.

I love Indian food, and I mean LOVE. I've eaten Saffron's food twice now. Once was to go and the other was dine in. The food is "good" but not great, though I will say the vindaloo has the potential to be amazing if they would just cut down the ridiculous amount of salt they're using. That's the issue I think, it was hard to taste past the salt. The naan was great N definitely fresh. The waitress who helped us when we were dining in was awkward, maybe her first time waitressing? I'm not sure but it was strange all around. We ended up having to ask a different waiter for things we needed because she was often chatting it up with customers at a different table. I might be willing to give this place one more shot. Third times the charm I suppose.

If 6 Stars were an option, that's what I'd give Saffron! The owner himself, Raj greeted my husband and I at the door and seated us. He kindly guided us through the menu and made fantastic suggestions. We were absolutely delighted with everything that came to our table. Nothing was swimming in oil or butter. It was however, bursting with flavor from fresh herbs and spices and each dish was perfectly prepared. Service also was top notch. We'll be back in no time. Do yourself a favor and get to Saffron!

They must have lots of friends, because I went here because of all the rave reviews. 

Went there just before noon on Friday. The place was empty. I should have taken the hint. 

We stayed and had the lunch buffet, thinking that would give us a sampling of their offerings. 

The food was bland, without taste. Probably the worst Indian food I have ever had. 

Do not believe the reviews, go somewhere else. 

The staff were very friendly, that is the only thing they have going for them.

I will definitely go back to this place.  Before Saffron, I have been to only 3 Indian restaurants which disappointed me enough to be wary of the cuisine altogether.  I am so glad my husband took me here for 'something different'.  Walked in, had a saffron martini drop (an original creation), and decided, yup, this is gonna be goood! appetizer:chili chicken 5/10 spice: Wow.  Bread basket:  garlic and cheese naan:  my son scarfed that down. Had chicken tikka masala and lamb masala: yum.  Staff were very nice, restroom was clean.  A bit of a drive from the strip, but from this experience, was well worth it.

This is the best Indian food that we have found in Las Vegas. They are consistent with the quality of their food and the staff is knowledgeable and very friendly. 

Saffron has a wide variety of choices and most dishes can be ordered at a range of spice levels, from a one to ten, with one being super-mild and a ten being set-your-lips-on-fire hot. When in doubt, go a number or two lower and work your way up!

If you are in the northwest, be sure to try this place. If you live across town, it is worth the drive!! Their lunch buffet is a great option if you are in a hurry or new to Indian cuisine and want to try a few different things. Be sure to try a mango lassie!
I eat here 4-6 times a week. Basically everything can be made vegan. When I call they go "same thing?" Haha yessss. They're the best !

Went there for the lunch buffet which had a very nice selection ! They had egg  rolls which kind of scared me. Samosas I get, but egg rolls? Food was very good but lacked spice and was too mild for me. What is Indian food within any spice right?
Tikka Masala was kind of flavorless . Service was great, naan was bomb. I'll have to go there for dinner and order it how i like . They had cayenne pepper on the side .

Our favorite place for Indian! The owner is awesome and personable and the staff are friendly and courteous. We eat here at least once a month. The food is delicious and spiced to individual desires. Our 4&6 year old daughters usually order a level 2 (up from 0 in the beginning), I personally like a mid-level 5 and my wife usually gets a 12 on the 1-10 scale, she tells them to ask the chef to 'be creative'. We've never been disappointed in the food or it's quality in over 3 years of eating here. We've been for the lunch buffet, the set lunch menu and dinner over the years.
What a wonderful little gem!! The food was amazing and I've never had Indian food before. A friend ordered for us but the staff answered all of our questions. Great service! I'll be back.

Be ready to wait for a long time before being seated. With quite a few available tables, we had to wait for a good 15 min to be seated and when I asked if it's going to take any longer I was told in the very irritated tone that I need to wait 5 more minutes. I'm not sure why we had to wait in the half-empty restaurant so we ended up leaving.
Great food and perfect filling portions! The team there was super hospitable and friendly in helping me select from the menu. Great bar area next to the dining room. I would highly recommend!
We love Saffron!  Best Indian food in Vegas.

Great food, nice atmosphere, a little more of a date night spot than family dining. Ordered three dishes and a few orders of naan. The naan aloo was by far the favorite, a little spice to the potato filling. The chicken biryani was delicious w healthy chunks of tasty chicken as well as vegetables and rice. My older boys loved the vegetable korma which was served with tofu. Chicken tikka masala was also delicious. Very fun Bollywood style music playing in the background.

On a whim, since we were in the area, we thought we would give this place a try. Oh man, I am glad that we did!! It was D-licious!! The hubby ordered the chicken J (don't remember how to spell the rest of it; and I ordered something that wasn't even on the menu, but they were more than happy to make it for me. They had a shrimp korma, but I wanted chicken instead. We both had our meals a spicy #5 out of 10. It was goooooood. It was spicy enough for me and I love things spicy. Also, if you check into Yelp while dining, you get a 10% discount. 

Check it out!

Stopped by for lunch with a few coworkers to get additional opinions and to order something off the menu with some kick to the spice level. The other three (one of whom had never eaten Indian food, none of whom had been here before) ordered the lunch buffet, and I ordered the Chicken Madras (chicken cooked in Madras curry) at 8/10 level heat.

I was very pleased with the Chicken Madras. A nice blend of flavors - savory, spicy, a bit of sweetness - combined with a pleasingly spicy kick that complemented the flavors rather than overwhelming them. The naan (we had one basket of regular, one basket of garlic) was excellent as well, served warm, crispy, and chewy.

Everyone enjoyed their food, and the other fan of spicy foods also liked the bit of Chicken Madras she tried, finding it spicy-flavorful but not overpowering.

Service was prompt and courteous, and the overall experience went well.

Given my second experience here, I'm bumping my score up to a 4/5.
Best Indian good in Vegas! This will always be my go to place for take out as it is SUPER delicious, fast, and everyone is friendly.

I've been lucky enough to have Saffron in my neighborhood but would gladly drive across town if I had to whenever I craved aromatic fresh Indian cuisine. Over the past 3 years I have sampled many items on their fairly extensive menu of traditional Indian and Indo-Chinese dishes. I have yet to be disappointed.  My personal favorites are the Goan Fish Curry and Chicken Korma. Their naan is also out of this world...always served fresh and warm out of the oven!

Great place for a nice Indian meal.  The prices seem to have gone up in the last year, but so has the quality of the food, so what's to really complain about?  From vegan/veggie options to delicious meats, the food is always consistently delicious.  The sweet lassi is also a favorite.

This was my first time experiencing Indian cuisine and it was amazing. My favorite dish was the lamb vindaloo. Good flavor, meat was very tender, just the right amount of spice. 
Great customer service, very attentive. I would come back again.
the buffet is amazing everything i mean everything is delicious naan bread comes included with the low price. very nice clean restaurant.
Best Indian food in Vegas. Completely delicious. Try the cheese fries in chilis. I forget what it's called but it's toward the bottom of the appetizer menu. The chicken madras was also excellent.
Great food and service. Will recommend to friends and will be back to try their lunch buffet one day.

Rolled over there for the first time (06/12/2011) and it was closed up, with a note on the door saying the chef was out-of-country due to a family emergency. However, they will be back!

Major bummer for me, but I give them stars for the note, the positive reviews, and good wishes for the chef (and his kin).

Sooo good!!! I knew I liked Butter Chicken but I didn't know it could taste this good. Seriously dying for good Indian food & that I've found this gem I will definitely be back! I'm usually super picky but how great my basics favorites are, make me super excited to try more

Butter chicken & cheese naan. Taste buds are in love :)

Authentic Indian food at it's finest.  A rare treasure to find up past Craig Road/95.  Full Service Bar.  Friendly and efficient staff.  Wonderful flavors.  All fresh ingredients. Food prepared to palate.  No bad surprises.  Delectable.    I highly recommend Saffron Flavors of India for your next Indian Food expedition!

The food is EXCEPTIONAL here!! The service however is VERY POOR, which is why I'm giving them two stars. There is one server most nights and she seems annoyed. She doesn't come back to check on you after she has delivered your food. She portrays an attitude of being inconvenienced. The bus-person does assist her with drink refills and delivery of food, he has better customer service skills than she does. 

Regardless of how exceptional the food is I will NOT give my money to an establishment that doesn't value their guests. I will take my money elsewhere!

This place is delicious and has become our favorite Indian spot in Vegas.  Start with the Samosas!  The Vindaloo and Aloo Gobi are also superb and the Naan is the best I have ever had.  Nice atmosphere and great service.  They get slammed on weekend nights but worth the wait for a table.

We had the lunch buffet and was very impressed. They had a fish curry dish - one of the only Indian food buffet places I've found with this. Lots of flavor - heavier on cumin and spices than an average place, which we love. Also very clean and excellent service.

The Skinny: came in for their $12 lunch buffet and was greatly disappointed with the lack of selection and the quality of some of the items... for f*(k's sake they f^&ked up kheer (2) service was good - nothing special though (3) value: given the plethora of Indian restaurants offering buffets in the valley, this one ranks poorly with regards to price, selection and quality (2).

Came in because we'd heard they were starting to do lunch buffets. Add the recent promotion of $2 off, we were psyched to try it out especially when it's a lot closer to our neck of the woods.

I was really surprised by the lack of selection available considering the price. For $12, there were 8 hot items (including rice) with a small salad/fruit bar and kheer.

But this would be okay if the food was fantastic across the board. However it missed the mark. Of all of the dishes, the standout was the Goan Fish Curry. The fish had a lovely texture while the curry was wonderfully mellow. However, you were pretty much dumpster diving to look for pieces of fish in the curry. Other than that, everything else was okay (lamb masala, chana masala, paneer masala) to not-so-great.

Of the not so great items was the dal (bland), the orange chicken (soggy, overly sweet --- I'm not sure how this fits in with everything else - this s*(t is about as American as apple pie), and the kheer. 

I have to take a minute about how they messed up the kheer. Not only did they cheap out on the rice (they used some sort of long grain instead of basmati), they may have used leftover rice to make it with the rather large clumps of rice emerging from the pudding. If you stirred the rice while you were cooking it, this doesn't happen. In addition, the rice was undercooked and hard. Plus you don't even get that hit nice hit of cardamom at all.  Bleh. Major turn off. 

The garlic naan came to the table nice and hot and flavourful. However texturally, it was a little too hard, a little too doughy and not enough flakiness. 

Sporting a tomato chutney, an unpleasantly weak mint chutney (where's the mango chutney?) and a rather watery raita, I was disappointed by the lack of pickles and other condiments normally seen at other places.

Given the plehtora of places available in the valley that offer better selection, better quality and overall better prices, I'd skip this place for the lunch buffet. 2 starred review.

The food is not authentic. Just using traditional masalas/spices doesnt make it authentic. Its the flavours that are created during the cooking process which make the food authentic. 

Sorry but very disappointed. 

Saag and chicken tikka were of the worst recepies. 

 Please open youtube and find a good recipe. Seriously tray to make food with some love, passion and care that is what indian food is about. 

The sad part is food was not worth the money charged. Totaly not fair we all work hard - quality should match the price.

This is our favorite place, we come here every time we come to Vegas. The flavors are explosively savory! Raj has definitely brought the BEST of India to the city that never sleeps. If you are in, driving through, or any where within a couple of hundred miles of Las Vegas Saffron Flavors of India is a must stop for dinner!

I was devastated when Saffron had to close its doors for several months, and the moment we read it had reopened, we were back there that night, ready for some more five-star Indian taste.

Alas, the only thing five-star about Saffron now is my husband's old review, which he plans to downgrade soon.

The staff is still friendly. The dining room is still pretty. I'd give four stars to both. The menu offers shahi paneer, so you know I'm already happy.

But did Saffron reopen with the same chef? Because the taste? Eh. 

Look, if you live in the area, then you're probably delighted. But it's nothing I'd drive across town for, which is exactly what we used to do. Now the taste is a little acrid, a little bland in seasoning, not nutty whatsoever in the shahi sauce, and although it was served a little hotter than before (I always order a "7" on the 1-10 scale, but I don't mind hotter), it was just the taste of heat, not the taste of complex spices.

If I were rating strictly on taste, I'd struggle to give it 3 stars, just because it's a little shy of "A-OK" and I've definitely experienced better (the 2-star rating), right there in that building. 

As it is, I struggled to give the entire experience 3 stars, even after factoring in the good points described above. Why? Well, we asked for our remaining food to go. "Do you want your rice packed separately or mixed with the dishes?" Odd question, but okay. "Separately, please." 

We'd left at least half of our meals untouched, what with not really being satisfied, but we'd hoped that - like most Indian food - it might taste better the next day after the flavours settled.

So, imagine how disappointed I was when I opened our puffed-out to-go bag when we got home. There were only two boxes. One had rice, and the other had our three dishes all mixed together.

It's Indian food. It's saucy. It's not going to obey the 1/2-inch "compartments" in a single to-go box. Huge mess. 

Now realize that my two vegetarian dishes were slathered with my husband's chicken tikka masala, and you can see why my disappointment turned to disgust. How cheap and unprofessional. We'd clearly ordered separate dishes, but even if we hadn't, I wouldn't want my own curries all mixed together in a single to-go box.

Saffron, this three-star rating respects the good times we once had. Good times I hope your other customers will get to experience. I know your heart is in the right place. But what you've got going now is *not* "A-OK." I hope you'll return to your prior glory, but I can't see driving past all the "sure thing" Indian places to take that chance again.

Hubby and I went last night on a recommendation from a friend.  It was pretty quiet when we got there - only 3 tables of 3-4 people.  The decor is a surprisingly pleasant m√©lange of Tuscan/Southwest/Indian, with gold, crimson, and sage being the main colours.

Server was friendly and attentive.  We ordered a chickpea marsala and a lamb tikka; both featured tasty, spicy sauces.  The naan was fresh from the oven and was lovely with the entr√©e sauces.  Everything seemed really fresh and nothing left a bad aftertaste!  Portion sizes are deceptively large.  The prices are a little higher than I expected, but I suppose one could split an entr√©e or two to try to save some $.

I would come here again!

I've been twice and each time I have devoured my food before taking a photo!! This place is great.  This is now my husband and I favorite place to eat.  The customer service is great and of course the food is good.  The only negative would be that the intensity of the heat for the dishes vary depending on who is cooking.  The first time my husband ordered his food with 4 for heat and it was quite spicy.  The next time he ordered a 4 and it was not very spicy. It could also be that he ordered two separate dishes also but it really isn't a big deal.  Everything from ambience to food was great, we will definitely be returning

Love this  place!! We moved away  from Las Vegas  2 years ago, but come back every six months.  Every time we stop in and say how this is  by far best curry we've  had in any state we've  lived in.  The staff are friendly,  food always  perfect  and restaurant spotless.

Went back here recently with friend in town who loves Indian food.  The food was EXCELLENT as always.  We ordered 4 naans and about 5 entrees, and enjoyed them all immensely.  The bullet naan was thick and filled with tastiness.  The peshwari naan for dessert remains one of our favorites.  We also enjoyed a dal, and some other vegetarian options.  My friend asked them to cook the dal in oil instead of butter and they happily obliged.  

Regarding some of the 1 review wonders who complain about how terrible the service is or how they have gotten sick...I have eaten here at least 15 times and neither myself or anyone with me has ever gotten even a mild upset stomach, and the service is always friendly and good.  

For those who miss the restaurant.com certs (as I do)...the waiter told us (might be the owner) that they are planning to return to restaurant.com, so watch for it I guess.  ALSO...I printed out a coupon from moneymailer.com (I think thats the site...google saffron flavors of india coupon)...it is the site that runs those envelopes of coupons you get in the mail every couple of months or so.  Anyway, you can print the coupon from the site directly and take it in..it was $10 off 40 or 1 entree free with 1 purchased with 2 drinks.  It isn't restaurant.com, but it helps.

Very limited selection for the buffet.... $9 is not too much to pay for, but compare to Indian buffet places i have been....this place is not very good. Since i was not convinced with the selection of buffet i just ordered their hakka noodles... so disappointed!! Too salty and it taste and looked like lomein... i asked myself AM I in a chinese restaurant... we are just so hungry thats why we went to this place.. and according to yelp it has 4 star so we went for it!!!! FRIENDLY advice try somewhere else....!

This is the sort of place that you just wished had more consistency when it comes to spice. Over the last few months we've ordered food to go 3 times and each time there's quite a discrepancy between the medium and the spicy and it's never consistent. The last time I ordered my 3 year old who does not eat spicy food ate my medium chicken without a problem. The time before that I ordered spicy and almost died. I reeeeeeeaaaaaalllllllly want there to be a happy medium that actually makes sense so I can be a consistent customer.

Customer service was great! The garlic naan bread was the best. I ordered 2 orders each of the garlic and butter naan bread. They give a lot of food. I ordered the food with the #6 spicy and it had a good kick. If you like spicy I'd suggest to order 10. I ordered the Veggie Samosa as an appetizer. It was delicious only came with 2. Chicken Tikka, Madras w/vegetable. The yogurt sauce was good.The food was tasty I'd go back.

Here we go again...

This place has AWESOME Garlic Naan.

As of late, I haven't been yelping a lot but with this trend of hitting an Indian lunch buffet every week, I feel the need to share.

***THIS IS ONLY A LUNCH BUFFET REVIEW***

After a disappointing experience last week at a different establishment (that we drove halfway across the city for) I'm glad to write a review about the place closest to where I live.

Saffron Flavors of India has a good lunch buffet.  

Let me explain...

First off, the service is great.  The staff is attentive and friendly. :)  Always nice to see GREAT service from anyone in this town.

Secondly, the food selection was good and the items themselves were fresh, not dried out (like some tandoori chicken at other establishments) and the Garlic Naan is AWESOME.  

Last, the place is clean.  There's really something to be said for this.  I've been to some other places and the glasses (or the water) are cloudy, or the buffet itself isn't appealing due to spilled items next to the buffet or on the floor, etc.  While this may not be the biggest place or have the biggest selection of items, the place is CLEAN and well organized. :)

Now with those things said, I'm sure there are those of you who may be thinking, "Hey, I read a few other reviews and they mentioned that there weren't that many items on the lunch buffet."  I sort of agree...  Then again, consider that the items they have available are not always the same items day in and day out and that the things that are on the buffet have great flavor.  It's $11.99 for the lunch buffet.  It's not some huge dinner feast, and it's not $49.95.  $11.99 will get you a sandwich and a drink at the place across the street and this is a MUCH better option for the same money.  Also, if you were thinking about it, since I mentioned sandwiches, the bread here...the Garlic Naan...is REALLY GOOD. ;)

I really need to come here for dinner.  I'm sure it's probably just as good if not better than their lunch buffet. 

As for the price, $11.99 is fine.  We're in Vegas and typically anything WORTH anything is $20.  If it's $11.99 and it comes with great service...  Well, there ya go!

Honestly, I'd probably pay $11.99 for a few baskets of their Garlic Naan. :)

Delish! Had butter chicken and vegetable korma. They also have some unique cocktails. The reason I say 4 stars instead of 5 is because I think India palace is a little better. This place is amazing though and it's great to see more diversity in cuisine coming to the west side
Love this place, the food is always perfect, and we carry out or get delivery

The guy who works behind the bar at night is really nice. We got a to go order once and my lamb curry was amazing! My mango lassi was on point as well. During dinner it is kind of pricey like most Indian places (if u don't go to the buffet) but lunch prices are worth the trip. The chicken tikka was great and the naan is so good here!
Awesome indian food, friendly staff.  Great little find in the Northwest part of town.

I ordered some food for pick up today. The servers were super nice and attentive. Now to the food. Not the best Indian food I've had, but also definitely not the worst. The best thing I at was the butter chicken. The gulab jamun could have been fresher though. The spicy level was a bit high, but I expected that because my boyfriend ordered the food. Overall pretty good, I would probably go again just because t is the closest to my work.
Excellent - food and service - the Gobi Manchurian is superb - warning if you are a novice eating India - start at 2 or 3 on the spicy scale! They also deliver!
The past two times I've eaten dinner their I've thoroughly enjoyed it.  Great service and very honest when asking for recommendations about the menu items.

This place is great... Especially for dinner. The food is authentic, the service is very personal, and atmosphere is great. However, I would not suggest going for the lunch buffet. I have been a few times and was disappointed. The best time to go is definitely for dinner.  You will not be disappointed...

I never had Indian food before visiting Saffron. After meeting the owner, Raj, on my first visit, he was very helpful in menu selections and really cared about our liking what he suggested for dinner.
We have been back several times since and have always had great food and great service.
I would recommend this restaurant to everyone! Thank you Raj for a great experience and even greater food :-)

I feel like this is as good as Indian food gets in Vegas! 

This was the best place for a date night last Saturday. We visited around 8pm and there was a good amount of people dining, but not crowded which was a great sign. We were seated quickly and approached with the cocktail/wine list and it's a surprising selection, I love that they have a few Indian beers from which to choose. After ordering some wine we perused the menu and found a fantastic variety of items and finally settled on Tandori chicken, Lamb Curry, Garlic Naan and rice. After we ordered the food came out quickly and the Tandori Chicken was sizzling hot, which was a great presentation! All the food was fantastic and the white sauce (their name for it) was such a great compliment to all the dishes. 

Luckily Saffron Flavors of India is located on my side of town but I would be willing to make the drive no matter what side of town I lived!
Ordered the Paneer Tikka Masala, Shrimp Saag, and Tandoori Chicken and they all tasted so good!  I highly recommend saving room for dessert and trying their Pista Kulfi...so rich and yummy!

First timer, and now we will be back as often as we can! I never had Indian food ever and the server was very nice and helped me figure out what may like, she did great! The heat index was perfect and I love the flavors with the all the dishes we had. The bar was nice, the tables nicely laid out and the staff was very pleasant.

WOWZERS! I am so so glad that I strolled into this place and check-ed it out.   I was craving Indian food so incredibly badly since I left DC and with no one out here expect for my coworker(who I can't lunch with during work) with a palate for Indian cuisine; I decided upon the first place I saw on yelp.  I saw the yelp reviews and decided lets go, thanks everyone! 

I was seated within 30 seconds of arriving and received my beverage within a second of sitting down.  The waitress then asked me if I wanted garlic or regular naan, and being me, of course I ordered the garlic!  She guided me over to the buffet, and basically told me to dig in.  *my eyes grew wide*  I started with a salad with the delicious cucumber dressing and little jalape√±o; tay-tay-tasty! Then I went and got my main meal, I loaded up with some rice and then piled the Curry Chicken Pepper splashed some of that Ritata sauce on there and headed back to the table.  After piling a mountain of food onto that yummy delicious warm garlic naan I shoveled that food down so quick and went for seconds, and then thirds!  Ahhhhh somebody stop me!!  In my many trips to the buffet bar I also tried the garlic chicken, which was good, almost a little dry, but it made the cut for me and then something else, to be honest I didn't even look at the name, I just dove in and took it; it might have been the Chicken Masala come to think of it.  

Overall the experience was a great one,  10$ for the meal and I will definitely be going back, possibly as soon as next week.  Stop everything you are doing this very instant and get going already!

If you love Indian Food you will love this place.  Its a brand new restaurant that everyone should try.  Its in a beautiful building with an amazing menu.

I had the Tandoor Chicken Wings, Reshmi Kabob, and some cheese naan.  It was all amazing.  It was spicy but not over powering.  It was like my taste buds went to disneyland and didnt want to come back

My friend from india was also with me and she was glad to finally find an authentic Indian food restaurant in the north west part of town.

So if you want to take you taste buds to disneyland too give Saffron a try
Wow....great indian food!!!  One of the best Indian meals I have had. Try the Combo "Saffron" Platter!

The quality food and service were very outstanding. The spices utilized on their food were remarkable. You can never go wrong with Tandoori-style chicken. I recommend this place for everyone that loves Indian food.

Really happy that they opened back up so I could finally try them. My mother and I went for dinner on a Friday night around 6 p.m. The establishment is divided into two areas. There is a bar on one side and on the other side is the dining area. There were a few tables occupied but not busy yet. Two very cheerful servers greeted us and after being seated asked if we had any questions.

Everything on the menu is ala cart so it can be pricey. They brought us a basket of papadum and couple of chutneys. The green chutney was my favorite, while the red was a little too sour for my taste. We started off with two mango lassis and paneer pakora. My go-to drink at any Indian restaurant is mango lassi. I can usually down 2-4 of them during the course of a good meal. These did not disappoint; nice and creamy with just the right amount of sweetness and perfectly smooth. The paneer pakora was huge. Not really that used to appetizers at an Indian restaurant being that big. We were going to get full before the meal came. The pakora was crispy and brown and we also spread the chutneys that came with the papadum on them. The paneer has a bit of a nutty flavor and is sort of the consistency of very firm tofu.

For entrees we ordered Butter Chicken, Tandoori Chicken and Kadai Ghosht. The Butter Chicken was good, I got it at spicy level 5. Was not to enthused about mom's Tandoori Chicken. It came out all sizzling and hot on the plate but the piece I had was flavorful but dry. Mom said I must have picked the only dry piece on the plate since her's were pretty juicy. I think my favorite dish was the Kadai Ghosht. It is a lamb curry with onions garlic and ginger. It was very tender and succulent and the flavor was out of this world. We also had panner naan (good) and garlic naan (very garlicky so very good) as well as they served us a small dish of basmati rice to share between us.

Now as far as the service goes, it's the type of service I expected. I don't think I have ever been to an Indian restaurant were the servers are snappy. They are not bad but if you are expecting to be in and out the you are out of luck. They were very cheerful and quite helpful. Our server was a bit too eager to clear our plates away (even when we hadn't finished yet.) I was a bit alarmed to hear a server recommend to a family a vindaloo when they asked what was a good dish that was not spicy. But considering they go on a 1 to 10 spice level for every dish I suppose that was okay?

This place is awesome and the food is even better!!  I am a Brit and my husband is Canadian so we both LOVE Indian food but realize it is not popular with most American palates.  This place has been open for a while and we really hoped that it would make it as it is a little hidden but very close to home so that's another plus.  We were there about 10 days ago and the place was quite busy so we were happy to see that.  I have always cooked my own Indian food before but don't need to do that any more - the food and service is excellent and the staff are very accommodating, do need to carry Mango Chutney tho' - pretty standard add on with poppadoms :)
A bit pricy but I love the food! I mostly do takeout but have dined here several times and I like the atmosphere inside.

Long time lurker on yelp but finally writing my first review on a well deserving place.

Beautifully decorated restaurant and very accommodating staff. The owner Raj recommended the Chicken Pakora appetizer for our 2 year old son since he can't handle anything spicy. It was so tasty that I had to refrain from eating his dinner. We ordered the Lamb Vindaloo and Chicken Madras both extra spicy. Both entrees were fantastic but the Chicken Madras was the winner of the two and will be our staple dish every time we visit. The Garlic and Cheese Naan were a must to mop up every last drop of our entrees.

They do have a lunch buffet which I look forward to trying many of their offerings. But I can see having dinner here on a regular basis. This is by far the best Indian restaurant in town.
Best Indian Food in Las Vegas, hands down. Friendly Staff and clean facility. Their Tikka Masala is phenomenal.

The food was very good.  It has been a very long time since the last time I had Indian food.  The fact that you can order the heat on a scale of 1-10 helps as my wife loves curry but doesn't like much heat.  The food was reasonably priced.  The drinks were a little expensive though.  Service was good, but they were not busy at all.  The food comes out quickly and hot and the garlic Naan is a must order.

This Indian restaurant is a gem and is definitely worth visiting, especially if you live in the NW part of the valley.  I took my family and my sister's family from California and all seven of us absolutely loved the dining experience.  

We started off with vegetable samosas, which were full of potatoes, peas, and maybe some carrots.  While the pastry could have been a tad thinner and lighter, it was delicious nevertheless.  For $5, we got two large samosas.

For our main course, we ordered chicken tikka masala, chana (chick peas) masala, tandoori chicken, garlic naan, chili fish, and garlic shrimp.  The last two items were part of the Indo-Chinese section of the menu.  Every one of the dishes was well-prepared, nicely presented, and very flavorful.   

The restaurant was clean and spacious with ample parking.  I have been to 8 or 9 different Indian restaurants in Las Vegas and this one is one of the best.

My favorite Indian restaurant in town. Delicious and great service!!! I have been to a lot of Indian restaurants, and this one is my favorite. I like the Tikka Masala and their cheesy garlic naan. The rice pudding is also delicious. This is definitely my go to place for Indian food.

This is our go-to Indian restaurant. 

Not only this place is conveniently located (well, for folks live in North West LV) on West Craig, off 95, their food is amazing, staffs are very courteous and attentive. 

But what separates this Indian restaurant from the other Indiana Restaurants, for us, is their Coconut Mojito!!
It's made absolutely perfect every time we order it too. Its refreshing yet creamy taste makes a perfect pair for spicy curry. 

My fav curries here are Kadai and Saag. 
I recommend going here as a group, order different curries and share.
Usually, me, my husband and our 4yo child order 2 curries, 2 naan. And that's plenty for us (complementary rice comes with each curry, not naan).

I'm coming from north NJ /NYC area where authentic northern and southern Indian cuisine is abundant.

Ordered a plain naan, chicken madras and paneer tikka masala.

Naan was fantastic tasting and priced well, $3.50 for 8 slices.

They got my order wrong and gave me chicken  tikka masala instead of the madras. I didn't complain because it was take out and didn't feel like driving back to the place. 

The chicken wasn't yogurt marinated and pre grilled before being dumped into the sauce, which to me is what makes the meat stand out at an Indian place. 

The sauce wasn't your typical masala either. It tasted like garam masala and chicken broth with way too much of.. Something that made the sauce quite light in color and not the red I'm used to. 

The paneer was similar. 

The attention to each dish was not there and was not what I expected from Indian food. 

My journey for proper Indian food in Vegas continues.

I love these flavors! Cheap it is not but quality it is!  Top notch.  Spring rolls were fried but super tasty. The Begay Korea with tofu was sublime. Rice basmati was fluffy and light. Extra order is 5 dollars but needed if you want enough rice to have rice with your second helping that you will not be able to resist.   The garlic nann is perfectly done, next time I will add cheese to the naan for extra goodness.   Also had the beef shank Indian style , it was insane.  I bet every dish here is good.   Try the tikka chip everyone was ordering it.   Enjoy 5 star at 3 to4 star prices we had 3drinks and it was 55 but would have been 30 without alcohol.  They do take out too!   Loved it all bravo!!!!!

I would say that Indian is one of my cuisine types where I am extremely picky and exacting. There are no many examples of tandoori spices and curries which seen hastily thrown together. In las Vegas there are no shortage of these types. Saffron unfortunately falls into this category. Everything was okay, hence the three star review, but really nothing stood out. Something like the tandoori chicken were very good, while the curries were thin and only mildly flavorful. 

I'm not sure I will come back. It is only blocks away from my house so I may give it a try again when I get the Indian craving. I would recommend Mt Everest on Sahara or Mozen at Mandarin oriental for top quality Indian in the city.
The food is very good, the servers were very plesant i would come here again forsure. Im glad there is a goo indian restraunt on this side of town.

This is the best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas!
I have been before and after the hiatus, and everything I have tried has been nothing short of amazing. 
The vegetable biryani is fantastic-not overly greasy, and incredibly fragrant. I ordered it "10 spicy" and it was a religious experience. 
The dal makhani is also delicious. Rich and creamy, but not overly so, as this dish can sometimes be. 
The naan is always hot, fresh, and fluffy. The environment is inviting, and the staff is very accommodating.
Pro-tip: take a date and sit in the romantic, more private section. So pretty!
Spend the extra few dollars a dish (compared to the average Indian restaurant) for an experience that is amazing!

I do not like Indian food. That is, until I tried this place.  They changed my mind about the cuisine and I'm thankful for that!  Since this place is literally around the corner, I finally decided to give it a try one night while having nowhere else to go for dinner.  We walked in to a smoky restaurant, more than likely from the kitchen in the back.  It smells like spices in the air, which was a nice change from the exhaust smell outside.

Their food is light, flavorful, and despite the small plates it comes on, the portions are deceivingly huge.  Their naan is beautiful, especially the garlic naan, which stole my heart and my stomach.  After several great dishes, from their chicken pakora appetizer -- crispy, light, and so darn good -- to beef kabob and chicken curry, the experience was an eye opener and a life changer for me.  

I'm a fan of Indian food now, so long as I eat here and only here for the cuisine.  You must try it!

Went there at 5:30pm on a Friday and the place was closed for dinner due to a music festival going on in downtown Vegas. What?? They close the place so they can go partying?? Otherwise, I've been there once and the food is pretty good.

The food here is fantastic, but my favorite part about the restaurant is definitely the servers. Travis and Jason are literally the best, they are super attentive and have my order memorized. My family and I come by every week at least, and never leave dissatisfied. Give Saffron a try, you won't regret it!!!

PS: Get the butter chicken

Our first time here was a great experience. We got there at 6p on a Friday and were seated right away. Early is key as they filled up fast. By the time we left there was quite a wait. 

The service was excellent, our server gave us time to review the menu then helped answer some questions which lead to some great choices. 

I ordered the Chicken Madras (spicy) and it was very good and plenty spicy. The curry was tasty with out being overwhelming.
