Great food great service. Their food is very flavorful and since we made the request for the spice level to be high. All the dishes came being extremely hot, much more than what we could handle (despite have a high tolerance for it!) upon asking if they could do anything about the biryani, they immediately replaced it with a less hot biryani but that too seemed way out of our league as we have had so much spice already down out system. They again suggested re-doing biryani but we didn't have anymore motivation to try another one and they happily took that off our bill. The service was fast, staff friendly and our server kept apologizing right till the end looking at our mouths burning. I would highly recommend it but would just ask you to be careful in selecting the spice level when you place your order. 
I am taking one star away only because I would have liked being warned on how high could their spice level mean as it was beyond normal levels of high. 

But overall very happy!

Terrible dinner experience, I question if they actually have anyone in the kitchen cooking that is Indian, the mixed tandori platter came out sizzinly on a fajitia platter, meat was dry, and the vegetibles  were oily and burnt black. The Naan was the only edible portion of the meal. The other dish  was lamb and spinich which was frozen and dyed a flourescent green. Pass on this place!!!!

Saffron is a wonderful Indian restaurant. The ambiance is very elegant and warm; it makes you want to stay or get a drink at the nice bar. The buffet, and let's face it buffets are why we eat Indian in the first place, was well stocked with a variety of delicious, perfectly spiced dishes. The nan bread was some of the best I've had, just light enough but very filling.
Great food, relaxed atmosphere, even have a buffet to try several items without having to order them individually! Curry is great, and Tandora chicken is really good!

OMG! The food is amazing.  I'm not sure how long this place has been open but I just discovered it.  I've been searching for a great Indian restaurant near me for a while now and this place is definitely my favorite Indian restaurant.  It's a little a expensive but definitely worth the money and I thought that quality of the food was really good.  Postmates delivered and it arrived earlier then they estimated which was nice.  I had the chicken Korma curry, lamb samosas and the regular naan.
I got food poisoning from this restaurant, I would not recommend this place to ANYONE. DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE GOOD REVIEWS! This place is also pretty pricey.
I have been here 3 or 4 times. The service and the food has been fantastic every time. I wish I had found this place sooner.

Tried this place for the first time. Two things that sum up Saffron:

1. Not a single Indian person was eating there
2. They serve spring rolls and hawaiian chicken in the buffet

There you have it. This is watered-down Indian food made for gum-chewing Americans. If you want more authentic Indian food then go somewhere else. Big disappointment.

Went here on Valentines day 2015 for dinner with Brian P. Came here around 8 ish with no reservation and were seated immediately. Place looks nice and service was friendly.

I ordered the kadai ghosht (lamb) with a spice level of 10/10. While I found it spicy, it wasn't singe your intestines spicy nor was it break a sweat hot for me. Brian found it to be inedible due to my extreme love of spicy foods that he does not share. 

Brian ordered butter chicken with spice level of 4/10. While good, I would say it was not hot whatsoever. 

Garlic naan was fine.

Portions were fairly small for the price but rice was included (not always the case at every restaurant.) 

I'd like to try their lunch before I decide if I'm a 4 star fan or not.
The garlic naan is delicious! Had the lunch special green veggie Curry, really good. Very pleasant service, will be back to explore the menu a bit.
Amazing friendly staff, very clean... and the food was amazing!!! I cant say Ive ever had such great Indian food!! far from my house, but definitely worth the drive!!!

Tried saffron twice, they have a few vegan items and the staff was great letting us know which items were safe for us. On our first visit the food was much better than the second. Our last meal tasted burnt, Bhindi Masala (okra).  While the okra was not overdone, the spices were terrible. Our other dish tasted chalky, much like my failed attempts to make curries using powder at home. Food was also very greasy, but that is expected with many Indian dishes. 

Might give the another try when I visit LV again, my mother likes her chicken dishes so would likely go back.

One of the best neighborhood restaurants in Las Vegas.  Fantastic Indian food and other dishes.  Nice vegetarian selections.  Gr8 cocktails and bar are a plus.  Mango lassi was the bomb.   Nice ambiance and service. I liked the traditional marsala, saag, tandori and onion naan.  Generous portions and fresh ingredients.  As good as Strip Indian but cheaper.
Best Indian food in Las Vegas!!! Love it

Just was not impressed at all. The place was just kind of odd. And I've eaten in a lot of Indian restaurants from a lot of different areas from India and this just couldn't seem to really figure out where it wanted to be from so to speak. The food was okay at best. It's the first time I've been to an Indian restaurant and I can say that all four of us. That the food was Bland. Cost approximately $100 for 4 people to eat and I don't mind paying for good food but it was definitely not worth it. Who knows, maybe we hit it on a bad night or with a different cooked. I had heard good things about it but all four of us were completely disappointed. Staff was very nice and very accommodating and it always strikes me as a bit odd when you go into a restaurant and you see no people of that particular nationality or origin eating there. Yes of course you can get your own ethnicities food at home but a good place will usually have people of that ethnic group coming out and eating. Just a thought
Amazing food and an incredibly friendly staff. We eat there almost once a week. The buffets is fabulous!
Fast service great food.  Super easy to do a order and pick up

By far the worst "Indian food" I've ever had. Only go here if you do t have taste buds. Literally anyone who has ever had Indian food will be upset coming here. I just spent 100 on trying allot of the menu and I'm very disappointed to say I hated it all. The sauce is there to mask the lack of seasoning . The naan is not good, the lamb was gross. I paid 20 for the mixed plate which had basically grilled chicken. That I could have made myself. This place is the worst. Mt. Everest is the best in Vegas. Don't let anyone with a virgin tongue tell you otherwise. Suck it saffron.

I was really excited to testing this Indian restaurant so I went there with my wife yesterday at noon to test the buffet.

The staff was really friendly but first surprise the restaurant was empty...
... Second surprise, the food was really basic, bland and not tasty.

I have real difficulties to understand why this restaurant have a such great scoring on Yelp... So strange!

Went to this place with a friend last night. We got their mixed tikka platter appetizer, which comes with a selection of chicken tikka, lamb kabobs, and shrimp, and then split a mutton biryani and some plain naan. Everything was extremely tasty, with a good balance of flavor and spice. If you live in the northwest part of town, you need to go here, period dot.

Pros:
* Very friendly staff, courteous and helpful with menu choices

* Large, family-style portion sizes and no skimping on ingredients - the lamb biryani had a ton of tender lamb chunks in it

* Naan is extremely fresh - come basically from the oven to your table

Cons:
* A tad pricey, but given the portion sizes it's feasible to split an entr√©e if you're budget conscious. We took home leftovers.

I LOVE this place!! The NW has been lacking for this type of establishment for some time. Food is really great and the price is good! I often have the lunch buffet through the week and take out when it's a weekend.

The flavors are unique and flavorful! Tandoori Chicken is always most and juicy, unlike most Indian places. Tikka Masala is my go to favorite here! I would recommend it to anyone in the valley.

Food was really too spicy to eat...I should have requested a 3 or 4, as the number 6 spice I requested was what I would've considered a 10!  I love spicy food but I really could not eat it.  The Naan is just so-so...It's a shame the food is not better as they are in our neighborhood.
Love Saffron, Raj and the team, the food is amazing, the freshness and quality is very good.  Highly recommend!

Good food!  I've only been for the lunch buffet, but everything they had was amazing!  You have the option of plain or garlic naan with the buffet, the garlic naan is delicious.  Great service, even though we had a carafe of water on our table, the waiter would still come by to fill our glasses while we were talking or getting food.  We didn't have any problems with buffet selections running out or anything like that, as is mentioned in other reviews.  I'll definitely be back!

Good Indian food!  I was a little disappointed with the roti but overall everything else was very good. The portion size is pretty large to share with 2-3 people. If you are not used to eating Indian food make sure you stick to 1 or 0 for spicy. I ordered a level 3 of the chicken korma & my non Indian friends were screaming it was too spicy! Recommend you try it, they have a lunch buffet as well as take out! I did the take out and it was ready when I got there! Delicious food!

Saffron is an awesome restaurant. They feature a particularly rare branch of Indian food-Indian Chinese. It is impossible to find Indian Chinese food, let alone GOOD Indian Chinese food. I had the chili paneer; it was LIFE-CHANGING. It was fantastic. I just wish this place was so out of the way, otherwise I'd be way more often. SO GOOD! They have other Indian options too, but trust me, try the Indian Chinese food!
This is by far my favorite Indian place.    The staff is friendly, the food is so fresh and has such a depth of spices.    The nan bread is fresh, hot and amazing.    I will be a loyal customer
I went there many time and looooove it! Now i'm craving but i'm working at home for elderly now. I wish they do delivery

Wow!!! What a great restaurant!!!

When you first walk into the place, you are welcomed by the scent of cooking spices. The atmosphere is warm and subdued and they have, what sounds like, contemporary Indian music playing in the background.

I ordered the Shrimp Vindaloo (I asked for "extra spicy"), and some Garlic Naan (flatbread). Both were really delicious. The Vindaloo was served with rice, which was cooked perfectly.

The wait staff was friendly and attentive and, all in all, it was a nice dining experience.

I got there around 6pm on a Saturday night, and there were several tables filled. When I left (at 7pm), the restaurant was nearly full.

I'm really glad this place opened up near me. There is one other Indian restaurant in the Northwest part of town which, unfortunately, I didn't have a good experience with.

But, I will definitely be going back to Saffron, again!

I believe they have a lunch buffet, as well. I'll have to try that, sometime.
